intro: Courtoisia, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. They typically grow in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Courtoisia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and are adapted to cooler climates.
